memberdef.name: GMOCK_INTERNAL_PARSE_FLAG
memberdef.initializer: if (!found_gmock_flag) { \ auto value = GMOCK_FLAG_GET(flag_name); \ if (ParseGoogleMockFlag(arg, #flag_name, &value)) { \ GMOCK_FLAG_SET(flag_name, value); \ found_gmock_flag = true; \ } \ }

memberdef.argsstring: (catch_leaked_mocks, true, "true if and only if Google Mock should report leaked " "mock objects as failures.")
memberdef.name: GMOCK_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "true if and only if Google Mock should report leaked " "mock objects as failures."

memberdef.argsstring:
(verbose, testing::internal::kWarningVerbosity, "Controls how verbose Google Mock's output is." " Valid values:
" " info - prints all messages.
" " warning - prints warnings and errors.
" " error - prints errors only.")
memberdef.name: GMOCK_DEFINE_string_

param.type:
"Controls how verbose Google Mock's output is." " Valid values:
" " info - prints all messages.
" " warning - prints warnings and errors.
" " error - prints errors only."

memberdef.argsstring:
(default_mock_behavior, 1, "Controls the default behavior of mocks." " Valid values:
" " 0 - by default, mocks act as NiceMocks.
" " 1 - by default, mocks act as NaggyMocks.
" " 2 - by default, mocks act as StrictMocks.")
memberdef.name: GMOCK_DEFINE_int32_

param.type: "Controls the default behavior of mocks." " Valid values:\n" " 0 - by
